00026 
00027 /// @file include this file to disable some of the warnings
00028 ///       we have in APT and havent gotten around to fixing yet.
00029 
00030 // @todo Including this file should be regarded as a bug,
00031 //       but better than missing a warning hidden in the rest.
00032 
00033 #ifndef _APT_NO_WARNINGS_H_
00034 #define _APT_NO_WARNINGS_H_
00035 
00036 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00037 
00038 // to turn these warnings back on, use
00039 // #pragma warning( LVL : NUMBER )
00040 // where "LVL" is the level at which it should be reported.
00041 
00042 // turn off warnings about signed and unsigned comparisons.
00043 #pragma warning( disable: 4018 )
00044 
00045 // dont complain about "unsafe" functions.
00046 // for this to work, this must be defined BEFORE including the standard libaries.
00047 // #define _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS 1
00048 #pragma warning( disable: 4996 )
00049 
00050 //#pragma warning( 1 : 4996 )
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #endif // _APT_NO_WARNINGS_H_
